Ik kijk ook uit naar mijn hoorzitting in het Europese Parlement @Europarl_NL om te discussiëren over de vraag hoe we in Europa op een rechtvaardige wijze een duurzame economie kunnen verwezenlijken waarin iedereen mee kan doen.

We hebben in Europa een ambitieuze, groene ‘new deal’ nodig om de toekomst van onze kinderen vorm te geven, en onze gezondheid, voorspoed en veiligheid te verzekeren op een groene en gezonde planeet. Graag ga ik hieraan werken in de @vonderleyen @EU_Commission de komende 5 jaar.

I’m excited to work on this for the next five years in the @vonderleyen @EU_Commission and looking forward to my hearing in @Europarl_EN to discuss how we plan to build a clean and sustainable European economy that leaves nobody behind.
We need an ambitious Green New Deal for Europe, which shapes the future for our children and ensures their health, prosperity and security on a green and thriving planet.

You can read more here about our Communication on Stepping up EU Action to Protect and Restore the World’s Forests
https://t.co/z1bBPHaWdd
We need to partner with other countries around the world, with businesses, civil society and science and academia. And we all need to play a role as individual consumers.

It is time to step up our efforts to tackle deforestation and forest degradation. The Communication the @EU_Commission has adopted today  is about both protecting existing forest cover, and sustainably regenerating increasing forest cover.

While the EU is not home to the major primary forests of the world, our consumption habits have a significant impact on them. The EU represents around 10% of final consumption of products associated with deforestation.
Forests host 80% of the biodiversity on land, support the livelihoods of around a quarter of the world’s population, and are vital to our efforts to fight climate change. https://t.co/1FpZjQmZ3W

My friends @mszptweet I admire your courage. You have friends all across Europe. We are watching Hungary. We do not want your freedom to be lost. We stand shoulder-to-shoulder with you.

And I want to talk to the Mayors here today. I want to establish a partnership with you on housing when I am @EU_Commission President, to achieve:
👉 Affordable housing for young people
👉 Adapted homes for elderly people
👉 More energy efficient housing

We need to urgently make the transition to a green economy. The conservatives pretend this will hurt average people. No! It will hurt these people most if we don’t act! These people can’t escape air pollution in dirty cities by buying a second home!

Salaries are too low in Hungary. The people at the top are doing well but ordinary workers are not doing well: teachers, railway workers, factory workers all need a pay rise, with the help of the trade unions.
And I saw on my last visit to Budapest how important it is to strengthen the position of the trade unions, so they can defend workers’ rights, in Hungary and across Europe.

We have our own answers to the challenges people are facing in Europe.
#ItsTime that companies making big profits in Europe pay fair taxes here.
We need a fair minimum wage in every member state of the European Union.
We need to put an end to the pay gap between women and men.
Look who Orban’s friends are. Strache, you will hear more about him today. And Salvini and Farage. They all admire Putin. Is that good for Hungary and for Europe? I don’t think so!

Fidesz and Orban are taking Hungary away from the centre of Europe, mentally and politically. The next step will be to take you away economically and socially. We will not let that happen! Hungarians belong in the heart of Europe!
It is only with free media that citizens can be truly free.
Hungary has been a proud member of the EU for 15 years and I congratulate you for that. But how sad it is that Freedom House now says that your country is only partially free.
I have come to Hungary today to speak about freedom. https://t.co/UXDUzmzscc

RT @PES_PSE: We need big tech corporations to pay their fair share of tax. The European social system is at stake. #FlorenceDebate #ItsTime…

The silent majority in Europe is too often intimidated by those who shout and spread hate.

We have a responsibility to give them a voice and build the EU which they want, based on our fundamental values.

The EU must work for all citizens. We need an EU for the many not the few. https://t.co/Z4OSRql9CQ

There is not going to be a European army any time soon.

We need more cooperation in the field of defence but we don’t need this.

If you talk about security, you need to talk about an American President who doesn’t value a strong Europe.

And you have to talk about Russia. We can’t be obsessed but we can’t be naive.

Europe needs to be tough and united if we are to protect our citizens.
RT @PES_PSE: There is an alternative to the Europe of Orban and Salvini. We are ready to lead that alternative. #ItsTime #FlorenceDebate @T…

We also need more transparency to maintain the trust of voters in European democracy.

Conservative forces are still refusing to have a mandatory transparency register for EU lobbyists.
We have given the European Parliament and the European people the chance to choose the future of the European Union with the #Spitzenkandidat process. To take that away would be bad for democracy.

If we screw up the ecological transformation then we won’t be able to look our children in the eye.

We can do it, but it needs to be socially sustainable too.

That means that those who can pay more will pay more.

We need to focus our investments on the circular economy.

We need to make the move away from fossil fuels and towards more renewable energy and sustainable industries.

Our middle classes are suffering and shrinking.

We need to fix this by creating responsible fiscal systems.

We need major corporations to pay fair taxes.

And we need to increase wages for the middle classes.

By the end of this month you will have to take a crucial decision about the very soul of Europe.

👉 People in Europe want to go forward not backward

👉 They want equality

👉 They want cooperation 

👉 They want sustainability

✊ We need to be on their side ✊ https://t.co/DSmseYn1j9

RT @PES_PSE: Great debate tonight in #Maastricht!
Thank you to all that have supported @TimmermansEU, in Maastricht, online or in Brussels…

#ICYMI here’s what I said in the #MaastrichtDebate tonight about the upsides and downsides of big tech.

#ItsTime that we make these companies pay fair taxes for the profits they make off your data. https://t.co/e3ZdIleCGz

The difference between rich and poor undermines our societies and fuels the far right. We need to tackle inequality.
#MaastrichtDebate

Costs of living are getting closer in Eastern and Western Europe. But wages are not keeping up. That’s another reason for trade unions to be given a stronger role to support workers in their negotiations with their employers.
#MaastrichtDebate

We need a minimum wage in every EU Member State.

And we need to protect workers. It wouldn’t kill us to pay an extra 50 cents for a pizza so the Deliveroo guy gets some social protections!

And we need strong trade unions for strong workers’ rights.

#MaastrichtDebate

My @EU_Commission won’t talk about quotas for women Commissioners. We will ‘show not tell’ and we will do what @sanchezcastejon did in Spain and put strong women in strong positions  on their merits.

#MaastrichtDebate
#ICYMI this was my opening pitch in the #MaastrichtDebate https://t.co/yAyLhxUgz2

The rest of the world wants to be on the European market. So our companies don’t need to fear being a green first mover.

That is how we spread our environmental values and create competitive advantages for our companies in Europe and around the world.

#MaastrichtDebate

Of course people don’t like it if you cut taxes for the rich and then raise green taxes for the poor! 

We need to make the ecological transition in a socially sustainable way.

#MaastrichtDebate

Green policy is not the property of the Green Party.

We are not up here in a beauty contest. We can have a broad coalition that delivers good results for our environment and fights climate change together.

#MaastrichtDebate

The UN Sustainable Development Goals are the world’s roadmap to a cleaner planet.

I will take personal responsibility for delivering on this as @EU_Commission President. 

We need to act now. This is urgent.

#MaastrichtDebate

“Education, education, education”

We need to keep our capacity for critical thinking. I salute the Polish people in particular for seeing through the hatred some people direct against the @EU_Commission and maintaining their high levels of support for the EU.

#MaastrichtDebate

Investing in the digital world shouldn’t be about building the next Facebook; it should be about boosting green technologies that will help us build a more sustainable future for Europe.
#MaastichtDebate https://t.co/beD17qGW1h

Así que el próximo domingo y en mayo: ¡Hagamos que pase!
 
¡Votarem amb el cor i omplirem les urnes de vots socialistes!
 
¡Fem que Europa canvïi!
 
¡Fem que Pedro sigui president del govern!
 
¡Fem que passi i anem a votar!

Amigos y amigas, la Europa que yo quiero tiene que ser un reflejo de la Cataluña y la España de progreso que queremos.

¡Y los socialistas somos la única garantía para conseguirlo!
El destino de España, el destino de Europa, ¡están en las muy capacitadas manos de vuestro presidente!
Como vuestro presidente el será capaz de diseñar la Europa que queremos y necesitamos: la Europa de los valores que habéis llevado a España y que queremos para el resto del continente.

En el Consejo Europeo es respetado y valorado por los otros primeros ministros por su capacidad tendiendo puentes y por ser un líder que entiende las necesidades de Europa. En menos de un año él ha devuelto a España a la posición de liderazgo que merece.
Ya sabemos que Pedro es de lejos la mejor persona para liderar España y su ciudadanía hacia un futuro brillante. Pero, ¿os he dicho alguna vez sobre su rol en la Unión Europea?

Las leyes garantizan nuestros derechos como ciudadanos, y se cambian a través del diálogo para sumar mayorías.

¡Para eso está la política! Para dialogar y como herramienta de cambio.

Como Vicepresidente de la Comisión Europea ya lo he dicho muchas veces, y hoy lo repito como Candidato Socialista a la Presidencia de la Comisión: Fuera del marco legal, del Estado de Derecho, no hay democracia, no hay solución a nada.

Os pido honrar en el día de hoy a la resistenza italiana y a la revoluçao dos cravos, porque hay algo en lo nunca ha habido duda alguna en el socialismo europeo: siempre hemos sido y siempre seremos orgullosamente antifascistas.
@pdnetwork @psocialista

Hoy es un día fundamental en esto: el 25 de abril se celebra la liberación nacional en Italia y Portugal. Pese a que pasaron en dos momentos distintos de la historia, el sacrificio de las mujeres y los hombres que lucharon por la libertad y la democracia fue exactamente el mismo.
Nos jugamos mucho en las próximas elecciones: nos encontramos en una lucha por el alma de la Unión Europea. Nuestros valores, nuestras sociedades, nuestro planeta y nuestro futuro están en juego.

En las últimas semanas he visitado muchas veces España y he podido hablar con mucha gente preocupada por lo que puede pasar en Europa y en España en las próximas elecciones con la extrema derecha.
 
Yo les respondo que tenemos un arma muy poderosa para pararla: nuestro voto.

¡Molt bona tarda Barcelona!
 
És fantàstic ser avui aquí amb tots vosaltres, amb moltes companyes i companys

Amb molta gent que farà possible que el PSC guanyi les eleccions a Catalunya i que Pedro Sánchez sigui President del Govern d’Espanya!

tweets.text:
"The world is coming together on this."

Executive Vice-President for the European Green Deal @TimmermansEU says scientific evidence on #climatechange is so "overwhelming" that people sense of urgency for leaders to act is increasing. MR

#KayBurley at #Breakfast https://t.co/mcFaYTeKzG

@TimmermansEU Das komplette Gespräch mit @TimmermansEU, stellvertretender #EU-Kommissionspräsident, im #ZDFmoma zur Finanzierung des #EUGreenDeal finden Sie in unserer Mediathek... https://t.co/e7DK5Qrl7y

Europas Wirtschaft soll in 30 Jahren klimaneutral sein – der sogenannte #GreenDeal geistert durch die Medien und eine unglaubliche Zahl: 1 Billion Euro. @TimmermansEU, stellvertretender #EU sagt im #ZDFmoma, das Geld sei da. #EUGreenDeal https://t.co/SZTVVQAQGo

.@TimmermansEU ist zu politischen Gesprächen über den #EUGreenDeal in Berlin - heute u.a. mit @peteraltmaier @BMWi_Bund und im Bundestag, morgen mit dem @Bauern_Verband & @VDA_online. Erhebliche Investitionen sind jetzt nötig, um die EU bis 2050 klimaneutral zu machen. https://t.co/Pq2fFqJkSq

.@peteraltmaier trifft den Vizepräsidenten der @eu_kom @FransTimmermans. Der #GreenDeal ist eine große Chance für 🇩🇪&🇪🇺, wenn wir zugleich unsere Wirtschaft stärken & gesellschaftlichen Zusammenhalt bewahren. Dann kann die #EU Vorbild für andere in der Welt sein. #Energiewende https://t.co/LLoTHDaM7H

Today we will announce the European Green Deal Investment Plan and the Just Transition Mechanism.
They will pave the way for Europe becoming the first climate-neutral continent while ensuring that no one is left behind in this transition. 💚
Stay tuned. #EUGreenDeal https://t.co/jci5gJAB3Z

Today Lisbon turns greener. Everybody, young to old, lent a helping hand and got their fingernails dirty. And in the end the targets were surpassed: more than 20 thousand tress were planted to help the capital breathe better! 🌱🌳 #evolui #EGCA2020 @CamaraLisboa https://t.co/Wonyjmgln6

Lisboa torna-se a primeira Capital Verde Europeia do Sul da Europa! @TimmermansEU agradece aos jovens por colocarem as alterações climáticas na agenda @ @greenlisboa2020 🌿 #egca2020 #evolui #EUGreenDeal @EU_ENV @EU_GreenCapital https://t.co/ptCShJayVQ

🎥 Executive Vice-President @TimmermansEU in #Lisbon, #Portugal: Visit of the Alcântara’s Wastewater Treatment Plan

#EUGreenDeal
Watch the video: https://t.co/VvvElohDxM https://t.co/zuDYC6VK5H

"Lisbon is going to be a leading city in greening Europe" - Executive Vice President @TimmermansEU today, the day #Lisbon becomes European Green Capital 2020 #EGCA2020 #EGCA #EUGreenDeal #EU #evolui #Lisboa
@greenlisboa2020 @EU_ENV @EUClimateAction https://t.co/Vksww9TNC4

.@TimmermansEU, vice-presidente executivo da Comissão Europeia para o Pacto Ecológico Europeu, está em Lisboa para visitar projetos, reunir com o Governo português e participar na cerimónia de abertura de Lisboa Capital Verde Europeia 2020. #egca2020 #EUGreenDeal #evolui https://t.co/fskDxinjg6

A Fábrica de Água de Alcântara trata as águas residuais de cerca de 800.000  habitantes da zona ocidental da cidade de Lisboa e de parte dos municípios de Amadora e Oeiras. #evolui #egca2020 #EUGreenDeal https://t.co/UKbQlrPzDX

No final da semana, dias 10, 11 e 12 de janeiro, Lisboa dá início às atividades da Capital Verde Europeia 2020 👌 O Vice-presidente executivo @TimmermansEU e o Comissário @VSinkevicius juntar-se-ão às festividades da @greenlisboa2020 com @FMedina_PCML. 🍃 #evolui #EGCA #EGCA2020 https://t.co/zO2xaTEhfE

A very good start of the Year : @beuc meeting @TimmermansEU to discuss consumer take on #EGD. Pleased to hear that EVP intends to put people's concerns over their health, their place for living, their mobility at the core of the Green Deal. A good resolution to certainly keep! https://t.co/ecO7g9KB4v

'There will be a transition but we can get there, it could be a new lease of life for the #EU. We need to make it happen in a way we leave no one behind.’ says @EU_Commission First Vice-President @TimmermansEU about the #EUGreenDeal https://t.co/cVtULJp3fT
.@EU_Commission First Vice-President @TimmermansEU: 'The EIB went from being Europe‘s best kept secret to being at the forefront of the fight against #ClimateChange' https://t.co/0PnEDb9p7f

‘We will redefine ourselves in the light of the #ClimateChange challenge. We need to have a clear roadmap to be carbon neutral by 2050. There are risks but also great opportunity to make it happen’ says @EU_Commission First Vice-President @TimmermansEU about the #EUGreenDeal https://t.co/ArzJkBkE0X

‘I have come with an offer of deep partnership. We have complementary expertise to make great things happen in the years to come and make this work to the advantage of EU citizens.’ says @EU_Commission First Vice-President @TimmermansEU about the European Green Deal #EUGreenDeal https://t.co/OmxGEyjysR

Straks: #buitenhof! @TimmermansEU over de Green Deal, @PieterOmtzigt en @MathieuLLSegers over de historische verkiezingsoverwinning van Boris Johnson, column van @sheilasitalsing. Kijken dus! 12.10 op @NPO1. https://t.co/GVQHdvVQGn

EU climate chief @TimmermansEU is at #COP25, pushing for his Green Deal, and says time is running out: "We have the means, we have the technology, we have the science... we even have the capital available for this... But we have to get going and we don't have any time to waste." https://t.co/XDXBGBMb0d

📺 Tune in! 
🇪🇺 press conference with @TimmermansEU & @BasEickhout on #EUGreenDeal and progress of #climate negotiations at #COP25 starts at 14.30 (Chiloe room, Hall 10).
You can follow the discussion 🔴 live 👇🏼
https://t.co/c1qN6Avg6s #TimeForAction https://t.co/eHdm5fagSv

We choose to go for climate neutrality in 2050. Because this is a challenge that we are willing to accept and one which we intend to win.

Watch the Citizens' Dialogue with Executive Vice-President @TimmermansEU on the #EUGreenDeal at #COP25. https://t.co/5GfWMv5Z1V

It is time to step up our efforts to tackle deforestation and forest degradation. The Communication the @EU_Commission has adopted today  is about both protecting existing forest cover, and sustainably regenerating increasing forest cover.

While the EU is not home to the major primary forests of the world, our consumption habits have a significant impact on them. The EU represents around 10% of final consumption of products associated with deforestation.
Forests host 80% of the biodiversity on land, support the livelihoods of around a quarter of the world’s population, and are vital to our efforts to fight climate change. https://t.co/1FpZjQmZ3W

My friends @mszptweet I admire your courage. You have friends all across Europe. We are watching Hungary. We do not want your freedom to be lost. We stand shoulder-to-shoulder with you.

And I want to talk to the Mayors here today. I want to establish a partnership with you on housing when I am @EU_Commission President, to achieve:
👉 Affordable housing for young people
👉 Adapted homes for elderly people
👉 More energy efficient housing

We need to urgently make the transition to a green economy. The conservatives pretend this will hurt average people. No! It will hurt these people most if we don’t act! These people can’t escape air pollution in dirty cities by buying a second home!

Salaries are too low in Hungary. The people at the top are doing well but ordinary workers are not doing well: teachers, railway workers, factory workers all need a pay rise, with the help of the trade unions.
And I saw on my last visit to Budapest how important it is to strengthen the position of the trade unions, so they can defend workers’ rights, in Hungary and across Europe.

We have our own answers to the challenges people are facing in Europe.
#ItsTime that companies making big profits in Europe pay fair taxes here.
We need a fair minimum wage in every member state of the European Union.
We need to put an end to the pay gap between women and men.
Look who Orban’s friends are. Strache, you will hear more about him today. And Salvini and Farage. They all admire Putin. Is that good for Hungary and for Europe? I don’t think so!

Fidesz and Orban are taking Hungary away from the centre of Europe, mentally and politically. The next step will be to take you away economically and socially. We will not let that happen! Hungarians belong in the heart of Europe!
It is only with free media that citizens can be truly free.
Hungary has been a proud member of the EU for 15 years and I congratulate you for that. But how sad it is that Freedom House now says that your country is only partially free.
I have come to Hungary today to speak about freedom. https://t.co/UXDUzmzscc

If you talk about security, you need to talk about an American President who doesn’t value a strong Europe.

And you have to talk about Russia. We can’t be obsessed but we can’t be naive.

Europe needs to be tough and united if we are to protect our citizens.

We also need more transparency to maintain the trust of voters in European democracy.

Conservative forces are still refusing to have a mandatory transparency register for EU lobbyists.
There is an alternative to the Europe of Orban and Salvini. We are ready to lead that alternative. #ItsTime #FlorenceDebate @TimmermansEU 🇪🇺🌹 https://t.co/7lDZOS2Q6A
We have given the European Parliament and the European people the chance to choose the future of the European Union with the #Spitzenkandidat process. To take that away would be bad for democracy.

If we screw up the ecological transformation then we won’t be able to look our children in the eye.

We can do it, but it needs to be socially sustainable too.

That means that those who can pay more will pay more.

We need to focus our investments on the circular economy.

We need to make the move away from fossil fuels and towards more renewable energy and sustainable industries.

Our middle classes are suffering and shrinking.

We need to fix this by creating responsible fiscal systems.

We need major corporations to pay fair taxes.

And we need to increase wages for the middle classes.

By the end of this month you will have to take a crucial decision about the very soul of Europe.

👉 People in Europe want to go forward not backward

👉 They want equality

👉 They want cooperation 

👉 They want sustainability

@TimmermansEU "Donde hay gobiernos socialistas hay transformación, progreso e igualdad. Por eso quiero ser el próximo Presidente de la Comisión Europea" #HazQuePase #FesQuePassi https://t.co/GRWzrdVwhm

Amigos y amigas, la Europa que yo quiero tiene que ser un reflejo de la Cataluña y la España de progreso que queremos.

¡Y los socialistas somos la única garantía para conseguirlo!
El destino de España, el destino de Europa, ¡están en las muy capacitadas manos de vuestro presidente!
Como vuestro presidente el será capaz de diseñar la Europa que queremos y necesitamos: la Europa de los valores que habéis llevado a España y que queremos para el resto del continente.

En el Consejo Europeo es respetado y valorado por los otros primeros ministros por su capacidad tendiendo puentes y por ser un líder que entiende las necesidades de Europa. En menos de un año él ha devuelto a España a la posición de liderazgo que merece.
Ya sabemos que Pedro es de lejos la mejor persona para liderar España y su ciudadanía hacia un futuro brillante. Pero, ¿os he dicho alguna vez sobre su rol en la Unión Europea?

Las leyes garantizan nuestros derechos como ciudadanos, y se cambian a través del diálogo para sumar mayorías.

¡Para eso está la política! Para dialogar y como herramienta de cambio.

Como Vicepresidente de la Comisión Europea ya lo he dicho muchas veces, y hoy lo repito como Candidato Socialista a la Presidencia de la Comisión: Fuera del marco legal, del Estado de Derecho, no hay democracia, no hay solución a nada.

Os pido honrar en el día de hoy a la resistenza italiana y a la revoluçao dos cravos, porque hay algo en lo nunca ha habido duda alguna en el socialismo europeo: siempre hemos sido y siempre seremos orgullosamente antifascistas.
@pdnetwork @psocialista

Hoy es un día fundamental en esto: el 25 de abril se celebra la liberación nacional en Italia y Portugal. Pese a que pasaron en dos momentos distintos de la historia, el sacrificio de las mujeres y los hombres que lucharon por la libertad y la democracia fue exactamente el mismo.
Nos jugamos mucho en las próximas elecciones: nos encontramos en una lucha por el alma de la Unión Europea. Nuestros valores, nuestras sociedades, nuestro planeta y nuestro futuro están en juego.

En las últimas semanas he visitado muchas veces España y he podido hablar con mucha gente preocupada por lo que puede pasar en Europa y en España en las próximas elecciones con la extrema derecha.
 
Yo les respondo que tenemos un arma muy poderosa para pararla: nuestro voto.

És fantàstic ser avui aquí amb tots vosaltres, amb moltes companyes i companys

Trade unions and political parties need to work together to defend women’s rights. We need to close the gender pay gap between women and men. And we need to make sure our Directive on work-life balance and shared parental leave is properly enforced.

We need to translate productivity gains into salary increases for European workers.
There should be a decent minimum wage in every Member State of the EU, set by legislation or through collective bargaining.

We are in the middle of an industrial revolution and we need to make sure that it serves the many, not the few. 
We need to focus on fair taxation to tackle injustice and improve redistribution.
We need a tax system that is progressive and takes into account the new economy.
We need to urgently fix our social contract. The concept of solidarity is being undermined because people are being made to fear the social progress of others.

Pleased to be at @etuc_ces this morning to talk about how we can put workers’ rights at the heart of the EU’s agenda in the next five years.

En las próximas semanas, debemos luchar para convencer a nuestras familias, a nuestras amistades y a nuestros conocidos ¡para que voten al PSOE! Somos la única garantía para un futuro próspero, justo, libre y sostenible en Europa.

Europa necesita cambios para seguir sirviendo a la ciudadanía, para seguir garantizando estándares sociales justos, para liderar la lucha contra el cambio climático, para mejorar los derechos laborales, para ser la voz de la libertad y la democracia en el mundo.
Y yo les digo claramente que nos encontramos en una lucha por el alma de Europa, y que nuestros valores, nuestras sociedades, nuestro planeta y nuestro futuro están en juego.
La gente me pregunta a menudo qué nos jugamos en las próximas elecciones, qué se juega la Unión Europea en las elecciones europeas de mayo.

Para que haya gobiernos socialistas, honestos y trabajadores, hay que votar! Nos tenemos que mobilizar y ejercer con todas nuestras fuerzas aquello que nos hace iguales: el voto como poderosa expresión de democracia.
Para mí, es todo un honor poder estar hoy aquí con Pedro como presidente del Gobierno de esta España moderna, democrática, progresista y europeísta.

Mi valenciano y mi castellano no son muy buenos, pero quiero hablaros directamente. Cuando voy por Europa y encuentro gobiernos socialistas, como aquí, veo gobiernos que trabajan para y con la ciudadanía, veo más justicia social, veo respuestas a los retos.

Companyes i companys, bona vesprada a tothom! Hui estic ací, a Castelló, per a dir-vos que guanyarem les pròximes eleccions europees, i les generals amb Pedro, i a les Corts Valencianes amb Ximo i també a l’alcaldia de Castelló amb Amparo!

We need a new industrial policy in Europe. We need the automotive industry to move faster in transitioning to electric cars. We need European champions in renewable industries. We need European champions in the circular economy.
Redistribution is at the heart of the EU’s regional policy. We now need to look more closely at the urban-rural divide. The digital transformation should help us to overcome geographic divisions.
In a post-paternalistic world you can’t negotiate a trade deal without a mandate from the European Parliament.
We are only 7% of the world’s population. A rules-based and values-based global order is the best defence of Europe’s interests.
Any future European Commission has an obligation to minimise the risk of the US slapping tariffs on European products. Because these tariffs would have an immediate impact on European jobs.

Trade deals were traditionally dealt with by politicians with little public attention. But all that has changed. People now pay very close attention to the impacts on health, on jobs, on the environment. And rightly so.
There is a feeling in society that people are not being treated fairly compared to big corporations when it comes to taxation.
We should include housing in these investments. We need to help young people get on the housing ladder and we also need to adapt the housing stock to support the needs of an aging population.
We need to make sure that investments from EFSI and the Structural Funds are directed more to sustainability and to small businesses.
We need to re-invent our industrial policy and make sure our investment policy is guided by the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

I’m not pessimistic about economic growth in Europe. There is huge potential in the circular economy. There is huge potential to improve productivity. There is huge potential to harness the digital revolution.

We have to prove that a different society is possible. We need steps forward on fiscal policy and on social policy, so that all Europeans feel there's a place for them in the society that we're becoming.
In a world where companies have more economic power than some countries, we need new economic tools and we need to act together.

Kicking off now, a conversation about the future of the European economy

It’s time to act on climate change. 
It’s time to force big companies to pay taxes where they make their profits.
It’s time for social justice and workers rights.
#ItsTime
I call on young people in Europe to have the audacity to lead. Use your idealism to set us on a path of sustainability and social justice.
Young people are asking themselves what is the right thing to do. The right thing to do is go and vote.

#ItsTime for social democracy to take the reins and to take Europe to a brighter future.
I want to pay tribute to @SwedishPM. Olaf Palme’s legacy is in great hands with him.
We need a sustainable planet and a sustainable Europe. And that starts with social sustainability. We must leave nobody behind.
The fight for equality is not a fight for women alone. The fight for equality must be for men too. I am a feminist. I am part of this fight.

Let’s have an honest discussion about how some politicians are using Christian values.

Christian values to me does not mean putting women in the kitchen and telling them to shut up.
Democracy, the rule of law and fundamental rights are all equal in our modern society. You cannot use one against the other.
Respect for minorities is just as important as the will of the majority.

There are parties all across Europe who think of ‘we’ and ‘them’, who want to exclude and divide.

We as social democrats have a duty to say NO to that kind of politics.

That’s what this election is about.
It is a privilege to speak to a party that has inspired me so much in my life. Olaf Palme was the man who first introduced me to the name Nelson Mandela.

I will be speaking in a few minutes at the Congress of our Swedish colleagues @socialdemokrat.

https://t.co/z2ZNPjWn1R https://t.co/5Tv5YTnlhv
A social democrat-led @EU_Commission would be a #feminist Commission.

Europe needs a strong social democratic model.

This means redistribution of wealth, knowledge and power.
But the European Union is first and foremost about defending our values, our fundamental rights, our democracies and the rule of law.
I would also work on completing the single market and the digital single market.
I would also make sure that the EU #EnergyUnion is a sustainable project.
As President of the @EU_Commission i would take personal responsibility for the @UN #SustainableDevelopmentGoals, and make each Commissioner responsible for implementing a specific part of them.

Good to be in Sweden to discuss our ideas for the future of Europe.
We are inspired by @SwedishPM and his success here.

Press conference time with @CSSD colleagues, talking to the Czech media about the importance of the European elections in May.

#thistimeimvoting 
https://t.co/uCACdalhe4 https://t.co/zgFctoNsRp
Go out and vote. For yourselves, for your children, for your grandchildren. Vote for a progressive Europe.
Everywhere I go in Europe I hear young people telling me #ItsTime
Going to vote in May in the European elections will be about choosing the kind of Europe we want to live in.
If I am President of the European Commission I will fight to eliminate the gender pay gap in 5 years. And I will come with tough measures to tackle violence against women.
East and West must be equal. And men and women must be equal. That is our fight in Europe.
Vaclav Havel once told me a beautiful thing: that our task is to make sure East and West are just geographical terms in Europe, not moral terms.
The cost of living in the Czech Republic is going up. But salaries are not going up on the same way. We need to work with trade unions to secure better wages for European workers.
There can be no second rate Europeans. And citizens should have access to the same quality products all over Europe.
I want a minimum wage in every state of the European Union. I want multinationals to pay taxes where they are making profits. Tax evasion is not acceptable in Europe.
The European Union is our home, the roof over our heads. But it needs maintenance.
We say no to governments controlling judges. Amd we stand for the freedom of the press.
Freedom needs permanent maintenance. We say no to fascism. We say no to xenophobia. We stand firm against antisemitism.
Now @CSSD is led by a generation who grew up in freedom in a united Europe. But we should never take our freedom for granted.
In the Czech Republic, people dared to dream about Europe.
The Czech Republic is one of the places where the movements were born which made Europe whole again.

Ok Europe, #ItsTime! This weekend we adopted our @pes_pse manifesto for the European elections. Our family is ready for the campaign. We are positive, we are enthusiastic, we are energetic and we are optimistic. 

You can read our manifesto here:
https://t.co/keer1PMQva https://t.co/iMGfdtVqsa
Spring is coming in Europe. You see that with young people in the streets fighting climate change. You see that with the #MeToo movement.
We are also a movement which does not compromise on our values. I have seen what happens in Europe when governments go back on our values and chain people to their fears.
Socialists and social democrats in government across Europe raise pensions and raise wages and protect people.
We need to let our children dream of a brighter future and more opportunities in life.
If I’m President of the European Commission I will work with towns and cities across Europe to provide more affordable housing for our young people.
We will leave nobody behind in the green transition.

Our movement started by talking about redistribution of wealth. Now we need to talk about the distribution and protection of our limited natural resources. We need a circular economy. We need clean water. We need clean air.
We need fair taxation in Europe. Multinationals cannot make billions of profits and pay no taxes.
We need a new social contract for Europe. I pledge a strong alliance today with Europe’s trade unions. We need to guarantee decent pay for decent work.
This is the first election where people born this millennium can vote for the Europe they want #ItsTime

To the students marching for the climate, I say: go for it! My kids do it too and I am proud of them. I have been saying for years to young people that I love their idealism but they need to organise, so it is great to see them doing this.

On Brexit, we have an obligation to make this divorce as amicable as possible. It is only self-defeating for us both if we make this relationship acrimonious. There is no joy in seeing the Brits suffer. It breaks my heart.
Guaranteeing the independence of the judiciary has a direct link with protecting the internal market. National judges are European judges and they oversee the application of EU law.
A democratic mandate to govern does not absolve a government of responsibility for respecting the rule of law.
I believe it is essential for the future of the EU that we assume collective responsibility for the rule of law. This is not just a matter for the @EU_Commission.
You don’t address people’s anxieties about the future with numbers in a PowerPoint presentation. And you don’t solve anything by getting stuck in inter-institutional blame games.

The outcome of the next European elections will reflect the changing political landscape at national level. Every party needs to understand that in the next European Parliament, no party is an inevitable part of the majority.
The 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals would be central to the European Commission if I am it’s next President, and I would take personal responsibility for that as President.
Europe needs more social justice, with a minimum wage in every member state so that young people no longer work for a few euros an hour.

People are now seeing the EU like a trip to the dentist. It’s important and it’s good for you, but you don’t necessarily like it. I want us to move from there to a situation where more people like it too.
But I also see people across Europe realising that we are all in this together and need to work together. That is one of the consequences of Brexit and of the current US attitude towards Europe.
Antisemitism is the canary in the coal mine. We need to take a stand against it. There is no place for it in Europe.
The nationalist answer to the challenges of the modern world is to seek enemies, and to give people scapegoats instead of solutions.
Citizens are asking fundamental questions of the EU institutions but also of their national governments

En tant que Président de la Commission européenne je m’occuperais personellement du développement durable. Plus on attend pour faire la transition, plus ça va nous coûter.
La gauche a toujours peur de parler de la culture ou de l’identité, parce qu’on croit que c’est un instrument pour exclure. Mais je veux que ça devient un instrument pour inclure.
Quand on a travaillé ensemble on a fait des bonnes propositions: sur le développement durable ou sur les plastiques, par exemple.
Le futur de notre démocratie est une démocratie inclusive et ‘post-paternalistique’.
On a un parlement européen très puissant, mais on a besoin des alliés à l’échelle nationale et régionale aussi.
On doit tous assumer les conséquences de la transition écologique. Mais ça doit être une transition équitable.
On n’a pas beaucoup parlé de la fiscalité ce soir. Mais je suis convaincu qu’on ne peut pas avoir de justice sociale sans justice fiscale.
On doit faire des propositions qui donnent de l’espoir, mais sans être irréaliste.
Si on néglige la question de la justice sociale au niveau européen, le peuple va se tourner contre l’Europe.
Le Parlement européen, élu par les citoyens européens, aura le droit et le pouvoir d’élire le prochain Président de la Commission européenne. https://t.co/vuWSHVnYaf

To the young people standing behind me, you must come with us and shape your own future. This is the first European election where people born in this millennium can vote. Don’t waste that right. Don’t give it away. #thistimeimvoting

We need to move forward on women’s rights, not backwards. We need to tackle the gender pay gap and the gender pension gap. It is time to smash the glass ceiling. Women belong in the boardroom, not in the kitchen.
Who are the biggest victims if we go back to the past? Women! I hope that people see that the nationalists’ nostalgic agenda is an agenda which takes women’s rights away.

To shape the future we need to tackle climate change. And we will take people with us if they believe that everybody is doing their fair share. We need social sustainability, not just environmental sustainability.
Social democracy has existed for 150 years. We mustn’t forget this past, but we mustn’t tie ourselves to it either. We need to shape the future, not recreate the past.
I am an optimistic person. So while we reject this kind of politics, we will never reject the people who have been tempted to lend it their votes. We will, and we must, try to win them back.
We see too many examples in Europe at the moment of politicians who are good at breaking things. But they aren’t so good at fixing things.
It is easier to divide people than it is to unite them. And it is so dangerous to our society if we turn opponents into enemies.

After 15 yrs of conservative dominance of the Commission we need a more progressive Commission Presidency. @TimmermansEU sets out a vision of Social Europe & collective bargaining taking a central role- curbing excessive CEO pay, redistribution of productivity to benefit workers. https://t.co/u11uUzgwpK

We need to translate productivity gains into salary increases for European workers.
There should be a decent minimum wage in every Member State of the EU, set by legislation or through collective bargaining.

We are in the middle of an industrial revolution and we need to make sure that it serves the many, not the few. 
We need to focus on fair taxation to tackle injustice and improve redistribution.
We need a tax system that is progressive and takes into account the new economy.
We need to urgently fix our social contract. The concept of solidarity is being undermined because people are being made to fear the social progress of others.

Pleased to be at @etuc_ces this morning to talk about how we can put workers’ rights at the heart of the EU’s agenda in the next five years.
#ItsTime https://t.co/5L46Bys5x5

Redistribution is at the heart of the EU’s regional policy. We now need to look more closely at the urban-rural divide. The digital transformation should help us to overcome geographic divisions.
In a post-paternalistic world you can’t negotiate a trade deal without a mandate from the European Parliament.
We are only 7% of the world’s population. A rules-based and values-based global order is the best defence of Europe’s interests.
Any future European Commission has an obligation to minimise the risk of the US slapping tariffs on European products. Because these tariffs would have an immediate impact on European jobs.

Trade deals were traditionally dealt with by politicians with little public attention. But all that has changed. People now pay very close attention to the impacts on health, on jobs, on the environment. And rightly so.
There is a feeling in society that people are not being treated fairly compared to big corporations when it comes to taxation.
We should include housing in these investments. We need to help young people get on the housing ladder and we also need to adapt the housing stock to support the needs of an aging population.
We need to make sure that investments from EFSI and the Structural Funds are directed more to sustainability and to small businesses.
We need to re-invent our industrial policy and make sure our investment policy is guided by the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

I’m not pessimistic about economic growth in Europe. There is huge potential in the circular economy. There is huge potential to improve productivity. There is huge potential to harness the digital revolution.

We have to prove that a different society is possible. We need steps forward on fiscal policy and on social policy, so that all Europeans feel there's a place for them in the society that we're becoming.
In a world where companies have more economic power than some countries, we need new economic tools and we need to act together.

Kicking off now, a conversation about the future of the European economy

Our top candidate @TimmermansEU kicks off the EU election campaign saying: Olof Palme was the man who introduced me to the fight against apartheid. Now we Socialdemcrats have to take the fight against nationalism, for democracy in Europe. @PES_PSE https://t.co/IHabpOtuyi
I want to pay tribute to @SwedishPM. Olaf Palme’s legacy is in great hands with him.
We need a sustainable planet and a sustainable Europe. And that starts with social sustainability. We must leave nobody behind.
The fight for equality is not a fight for women alone. The fight for equality must be for men too. I am a feminist. I am part of this fight.

Let’s have an honest discussion about how some politicians are using Christian values.

Christian values to me does not mean putting women in the kitchen and telling them to shut up.
Democracy, the rule of law and fundamental rights are all equal in our modern society. You cannot use one against the other.
Respect for minorities is just as important as the will of the majority.

There are parties all across Europe who think of ‘we’ and ‘them’, who want to exclude and divide.

We as social democrats have a duty to say NO to that kind of politics.

That’s what this election is about.
It is a privilege to speak to a party that has inspired me so much in my life. Olaf Palme was the man who first introduced me to the name Nelson Mandela.

I will be speaking in a few minutes at the Congress of our Swedish colleagues @socialdemokrat. 

You can watch live here:
https://t.co/z2ZNPjWn1R https://t.co/5Tv5YTnlhv

Europe needs a strong social democratic model.

This means redistribution of wealth, knowledge and power.
But the European Union is first and foremost about defending our values, our fundamental rights, our democracies and the rule of law.
I would also work on completing the single market and the digital single market.
I would also make sure that the EU #EnergyUnion is a sustainable project.
As President of the @EU_Commission i would take personal responsibility for the @UN #SustainableDevelopmentGoals, and make each Commissioner responsible for implementing a specific part of them.

Good to be in Sweden to discuss our ideas for the future of Europe.
We are inspired by @SwedishPM and his success here.

Frans @TimmermansEU je med obiskom v Sloveniji poudaril, da je vesel, da lahko govori o Evropi, ki jo sanja. “To je Evropa, kjer bo za ljudi poskrbljeno bolje, kot je danes, in kjer je tisto, kar skupaj zaslužimo, bolj pravično porazdeljeno v družbi.” -> https://t.co/Iym1zIredo https://t.co/Hu720uxX1V
The turnout in the last European election in the Czech Republic was 18.2%. If you are young and you REALLY want to change Europe, go out and vote! 🇪🇺🇨🇿 #ItsTime https://t.co/BOSjzJNMnI
Everywhere I go in Europe I hear young people telling me #ItsTime
Going to vote in May in the European elections will be about choosing the kind of Europe we want to live in.
If I am President of the European Commission I will fight to eliminate the gender pay gap in 5 years. And I will come with tough measures to tackle violence against women.
East and West must be equal. And men and women must be equal. That is our fight in Europe.
Vaclav Havel once told me a beautiful thing: that our task is to make sure East and West are just geographical terms in Europe, not moral terms.
The cost of living in the Czech Republic is going up. But salaries are not going up on the same way. We need to work with trade unions to secure better wages for European workers.
There can be no second rate Europeans. And citizens should have access to the same quality products all over Europe.
I want a minimum wage in every state of the European Union. I want multinationals to pay taxes where they are making profits. Tax evasion is not acceptable in Europe.
The European Union is our home, the roof over our heads. But it needs maintenance.
We say no to governments controlling judges. Amd we stand for the freedom of the press.
Freedom needs permanent maintenance. We say no to fascism. We say no to xenophobia. We stand firm against antisemitism.
Now @CSSD is led by a generation who grew up in freedom in a united Europe. But we should never take our freedom for granted.
In the Czech Republic, people dared to dream about Europe.
The Czech Republic is one of the places where the movements were born which made Europe whole again.

We are also a movement which does not compromise on our values. I have seen what happens in Europe when governments go back on our values and chain people to their fears.
Socialists and social democrats in government across Europe raise pensions and raise wages and protect people.
We need to let our children dream of a brighter future and more opportunities in life.
If I’m President of the European Commission I will work with towns and cities across Europe to provide more affordable housing for our young people.
We will leave nobody behind in the green transition.

We need a new social contract for Europe. I pledge a strong alliance today with Europe’s trade unions. We need to guarantee decent pay for decent work.

To the students marching for the climate, I say: go for it! My kids do it too and I am proud of them. I have been saying for years to young people that I love their idealism but they need to organise, so it is great to see them doing this.

On Brexit, we have an obligation to make this divorce as amicable as possible. It is only self-defeating for us both if we make this relationship acrimonious. There is no joy in seeing the Brits suffer. It breaks my heart.
Guaranteeing the independence of the judiciary has a direct link with protecting the internal market. National judges are European judges and they oversee the application of EU law.
A democratic mandate to govern does not absolve a government of responsibility for respecting the rule of law.
I believe it is essential for the future of the EU that we assume collective responsibility for the rule of law. This is not just a matter for the @EU_Commission.
You don’t address people’s anxieties about the future with numbers in a PowerPoint presentation. And you don’t solve anything by getting stuck in inter-institutional blame games.

The outcome of the next European elections will reflect the changing political landscape at national level. Every party needs to understand that in the next European Parliament, no party is an inevitable part of the majority.
The 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals would be central to the European Commission if I am it’s next President, and I would take personal responsibility for that as President.
Europe needs more social justice, with a minimum wage in every member state so that young people no longer work for a few euros an hour.

People are now seeing the EU like a trip to the dentist. It’s important and it’s good for you, but you don’t necessarily like it. I want us to move from there to a situation where more people like it too.
But I also see people across Europe realising that we are all in this together and need to work together. That is one of the consequences of Brexit and of the current US attitude towards Europe.
Antisemitism is the canary in the coal mine. We need to take a stand against it. There is no place for it in Europe.
The nationalist answer to the challenges of the modern world is to seek enemies, and to give people scapegoats instead of solutions.
Citizens are asking fundamental questions of the EU institutions but also of their national governments

La gauche a toujours peur de parler de la culture ou de l’identité, parce qu’on croit que c’est un instrument pour exclure. Mais je veux que ça devient un instrument pour inclure.
Quand on a travaillé ensemble on a fait des bonnes propositions: sur le développement durable ou sur les plastiques, par exemple.
Le futur de notre démocratie est une démocratie inclusive et ‘post-paternalistique’.
On a un parlement européen très puissant, mais on a besoin des alliés à l’échelle nationale et régionale aussi.
On doit tous assumer les conséquences de la transition écologique. Mais ça doit être une transition équitable.
On n’a pas beaucoup parlé de la fiscalité ce soir. Mais je suis convaincu qu’on ne peut pas avoir de justice sociale sans justice fiscale.
On doit faire des propositions qui donnent de l’espoir, mais sans être irréaliste.
Si on néglige la question de la justice sociale au niveau européen, le peuple va se tourner contre l’Europe.

We need to move forward on women’s rights, not backwards. We need to tackle the gender pay gap and the gender pension gap. It is time to smash the glass ceiling. Women belong in the boardroom, not in the kitchen.
Who are the biggest victims if we go back to the past? Women! I hope that people see that the nationalists’ nostalgic agenda is an agenda which takes women’s rights away.

To shape the future we need to tackle climate change. And we will take people with us if they believe that everybody is doing their fair share. We need social sustainability, not just environmental sustainability.
Social democracy has existed for 150 years. We mustn’t forget this past, but we mustn’t tie ourselves to it either. We need to shape the future, not recreate the past.
I am an optimistic person. So while we reject this kind of politics, we will never reject the people who have been tempted to lend it their votes. We will, and we must, try to win them back.
We see too many examples in Europe at the moment of politicians who are good at breaking things. But they aren’t so good at fixing things.
It is easier to divide people than it is to unite them. And it is so dangerous to our society if we turn opponents into enemies.
